title: A fuse box containing 20 fuses, of which 5 are defective. If 2 fuses are selected at random and removed from the box in succession without replacing the first, what is the probability that both fuses are defective? - Quora

response.answer_text: Probability of selecting any two fuses is 20C2 = 190. Now as said, there are 5 defective fuses in box out of 20 fuses. So to select two defective fuses, we have to pick 1 defective fuse (that means 5C1) and then other defective fuse(now 4 defective are left so 4C1). Therefore probability is = 5C1.4C1/20C2 = 5*4/190 .•. Probability = 2/19. I hope that you have got your answer and understood it 😊😉.

5defective fuses in a box of 20. Probability of Getting first fuse defective =5/20=1/4 Probability of getting second fuse defective without replacing first one =4/19 As there are 4 defective fuses left out of 19. P(getting both the fuses defective) = 1/4× 4/19 =1/19.

Probability of a fuse being defective = 5/20 = 1/4 . Let A, B denote respectively the events that first drawn fuse is defective & the second drawn fuse is again defective. We are required to find the probability P(AB) . But P(AB) = P(A).P(B/A) = (1/4)×(4/19) = 1/19.

Probability of first fuse being defective is 5/20= 1/4 When the first defective fuse taken out has been found to be defective the probability that 2nd fuse drawn is also defective is 4/ 19 The probability that the both fuses drawn out in succession are defectives is 1/4*4/19= 1/19
